intro: Pisophaca greenei, commonly known as Greene's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. Pisophaca greenei is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
